title: How much time will be taken to cover a distance of 250 km in a speed of 50 km per hour? - Quora

response.answer_text: Distance traveled, elapsed time and average speed are always involved in uniform motion problems. their forms are distance traveled = speed * elapsed time, speed = distance traveled / elapsed time and elapsed time = distance traveled / speed. The given data are d = 250 km, v = 50 km/h and t = ???. Solving for the elapsed time elapsed time = distance traveled / speed elapsed time = 250 km / 50 km/h elapsed time = ??? hours, I know you can do the designated division.

Well if u start the clock at 50kmph it might be obvious it will take 5 hours but there is a whole load of differentials to consider i.e. wind and weather conditions so the question needs clarification.
Time = Distance / Rate (speed) In your case: Time = 250 / 50 You can do the math, hopefully without needing a calculator.
250 km/50 km/hr = 250 km*hr/50 km = 5 hr. It will take 5 hours to cover a distance of 250 km at a speed of 50 km/hr.

Repeating myself: Message to those answering homework questions: Who you think you are helping answering what is a duty of the one asking? Surely not her/him and, as a collateral damage, you are hitting their teachers, their families and the future citizens, not to mention the future of civilization. And yes, I am a p… o… teacher!
5 hours assuming constant speed, no stops, or changes in direction
